Posted By: TheDonMega (6/15/2012 9:18:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For those who don't "get" this card, it's called [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel) for a reason. Whenever a creature leaves play it loses all damage and counters and when it comes into play it's untapped. Flash allows Restoration Angel to swoop in and essentially save almost any creature you have in combat.  
  
Where it will really becomes a nightmare is when it starts setting off infinite flicker combos which'll trigger "comes into play" and "leaves play" conditional abilities an unlimited number of times.
posts.html:
For those who don't "get" this card, it's called Restoration Angel for a reason. Whenever a creature leaves play it loses all damage and counters and when it comes into play it's untapped. Flash allows Restoration Angel to swoop in and essentially save almost any creature you have in combat.

Where it will really becomes a nightmare is when it starts setting off infinite flicker combos which'll trigger "comes into play" and "leaves play" conditional abilities an unlimited number of times.

posts.post_content:
Combos with creatures. Seriously, she's good enough that it's simpler to say that she just combos with almost all of them. [Phage the Untouchable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phage the Untouchable) is a rare counter example. In Standard alone:  
  
[Augur of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Augur of Bolas)  
[Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk)  
[Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage)  
[Huntmaster of the Fells](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Huntmaster of the Fells)  
[Viashino Firstblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viashino Firstblade) (no, really -- it might see play thanks to this and [Deputy of Acquittals](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deputy of Acquittals))  
[Obzedat, Ghost Council](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obzedat, Ghost Council)  
Any Primordial  
[Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime)  
Any human in conjunction with [Champion of the Parish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of the Parish), or any creature in conjunction with [Champion of Lambholt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of Lambholt)  
Evolve stuff  
[Centaur Healer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Centaur Healer)  
[Trostani, Selesnya's Voice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani, Selesnya's Voice)  
[Craterhoof Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Craterhoof Behemoth)  
[Zealous Conscripts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zealous Conscripts)  
  
Not to mention what she combos with if we go further back. One of the best ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Since he won't normally be able to tap right after coming back from Restoration Angel, you need to add a global haste card (such as [Fervor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fervor) or [Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urabrask)) in order to make the [Kiki-Jiki](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiki-Jiki) combo net you infinite Angels. Its basically a 3 card [Deceiver Exarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deceiver Exarch) + [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin).
posts.html:
Since he won't normally be able to tap right after coming back from Restoration Angel, you need to add a global haste card (such as Fervor or Urabrask) in order to make the Kiki-Jiki combo net you infinite Angels. Its basically a 3 card Deceiver Exarch + Splinter Twin.
